com.googlecode.gwtmvc.client
Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.gwtmvc.client.Controller

public abstract class Controller
extends Object

The controller acts as a coordinator. It responds to user gestures, call the model and select the correct view to render.
USAGE: The controller knows its models and can call their methods. The controller knows its view and can render them.
To render the view, the controller could place them and render them himself, or use a DomPlacer.
Create an inner Enum class of the possible actions, and pass its values in the constructor to enable the event Handling.

See Also:
Model, View, DomPlacer

Method Detail

init

protected abstract void init()
Initialise the controller. This method is called at the first time the controller handle an event.
Use doInitIfNecessary if you want the controller to be initialised in other cases.

showHomeView

public abstract void showHomeView()
Show the default page for this controller.
This could be the application Home Page, for the rootController, or an intermedaite 'home' page for other controllers.

call

public void call(MvcEvent event)
Manages user gestures and browser events. User gesture must programatically be redirected to this method with corrects parameters. Browser events are automatically redirected to this method, without arguments. Auto-initalise the controller if necessary.

Parameters:
event -

couldHandleUserEvent

protected boolean couldHandleUserEvent(MvcEvent event)

handleUserEvent

protected void handleUserEvent(MvcEvent event)

doInitIfNecessary

protected void doInitIfNecessary()
Allow the controller to be initialised only once. The initialisation is done at the first call of this controller.

handleEvent

protected abstract void handleEvent(MvcEvent event)
Manages user gestures.
This method should not be called directly, Use call instead, to allow the controller to be initialised and to allow the maskable system.
Implements this method by 'switching' the different events available for this controller.

Parameters:
event -

renderView

protected abstract void renderView(IView view)
Place the view on the dom tree, and 'render' it. You could use a Dom Placer for that.

Parameters:
view -

IView.render(), DomPlacer

protected MvcEvent tryConvertBrowserEventToControllerEvent(BrowserEvent browserEvent)
Try to convert the event

Parameters:
browserEvent -
Returns:
a new event if the controller could handle it, null if the browser Event token dont match with any action.

handleBrowserEvent

protected boolean handleBrowserEvent(BrowserEvent browserEvent)
Manages history. use the controller itself or his childs to handle the browser event. You should not call this method directly.

Parameters:
browserEvent -
Returns:
true if the historyToken match to an action on any controller

getChildren

protected List<Controller> getChildren()
Give the controller's children. All controller must be part of a tree.
The top parent controller is called root controller.
